Title: Provision of Prepaid Card Accounts
Description:
The North East Procurement Organisation (NEPO) Framework Contract award for the provision of Prepaid Card Accounts allowing Contracting Authorities an alternative method to manage their cash disbursements and budget monitoring. 

Prepaid Card Accounts will operate similar to a standard UK Bank Account, including the option to withdraw cash from an ATM, make regular payments, pay vendors and receive regular statements. Prepaid Card Accounts do not have an accessible overdraft facility.
Prepaid Cards operate much in the same way as standard Debit Card whereby funds will be preloaded by Contracting Authorities and used by the Cardholder until the balance is exhausted. 

It is anticipated that Contracting Authorities will primarily use Prepaid Card Accounts for Social/Health Care related Direct Payments and for the management of Corporate Expenses. This is not exhaustive and Contracting Authorities may require the Prepaid Card Accounts for additional related services.

Title: Provision of Pre-Paid Card Accounts
Description:
Prepaid cards, which are similar to a debit card, were primarily used to replace the manual distribution of cash to Client Finance service users (those subject to an appointeeship / Court of Protection deputyship) and for the direct payment to service users in Adults and Children social care. Following the implementation, the offer of a card for a direct payment for Adult Services has ceased.

There are currently three active programmes using prepaid cards, provided to the council by Prepaid Card Financial Services (PFS):

• Client Finance Programme
• Direct Payments - Children's Services
• Corporate Procurement Programme.

Description:

Title: Pre-Paid Cards
Description:
The Council is responsible for making payments to various persons in the discharge of its duties and functions (statutory and otherwise) across various client groups in order to purchase goods and services that meet the needs or outcomes of individuals eligible needs as agreed by the individual. Currently the council offers a pre-paid card to adults and carers with a direct payment. The council is now ready to roll out the pre-paid card to other client groups for whom the council currently pays money directly into their bank account.
The Council requires the continued delivery of an electronic payment and payment card solution to be provided for its current customers. In addition to this, the council wishes to expand the pre-paid card into other schemes as stated in the specification.
Additional Text:

Title: SS15 148 Kent Card
Description: This tender is for the provision of pre paid cards (the Kent Card) and associated services. The Kent Card is used by the Council to make direct payments to eligible members of the public. Please refer to the Invitation to Tender for further information. Tender submissions were evaluated in accordance with the assessment methodology stated within the published Invitation to Tender and the contract was awarded to the highest scoring tenderer. The initial contract term is three years with an option to extend the contract for a further period of twelve months and a subsequent option to extend the contract for a further period of twelve months at the Council's discretion (3 years initial term+ 1 year optional extension + 1 year optional extension).

Title: Leicestershire County Council Direct Payment Card Service
Description:
Leicestershire County Council is inviting tenders for the supply of pre-paid payment cards with associated accounts. The cards and accounts aim to help persons (Account Holders) in receipt of cash and direct payments manage the payments and assist in improving their outcomes as well as providing   reporting / Management Information transparency for Leicestershire County Council (LCC).
LCC aims to retain ownership of funds it transfers into the accounts/cards and requires an online reporting system which allows access to account details.  LCC is seeking a supplier that can offer the Account Holders an experience which is the same as a standard UK bank account, both for card / account use, including Account Holder support such as the ability to manage the account online.

Title: Direct Payment Accounts for Citizens
Description: Nottingham City Council (NCC) wishes to invite tenders for the supply of pre-paid payment card accounts, (accompanied by an online user portal, and a telephone helpline) which enables citizens where practicable to self-manage their payments. This will be for a variety of functions, including but not limited to:    Direct payments  Personal and health budgets Emergency and crisis payments Court of protection payments Citizens with no access to 'high street' bank accounts Citizens who have no recourse to public funds Parents accessing Special Educational Need service provision funds Fostering services Staff expenses and payments    The Provider must offer the account holder an experience which is the same as a standard UK bank account, both for card/account usage, including user support such as telephone and online facilities,. It will, however, not include the use of cheques or overdraft facilities.
